intro: Weigela hendersonii, commonly known as Henderson's weigela, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It features showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are dark green and provide attractive foliage throughout the growing season. It typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet and has a compact, rounded form. The bark is smooth and reddish-brown, adding visual interest in the winter months.
